definition: A fundamental and indivisible component or constituent of something, often used in scientific or philosophical contexts to refer to the basic building blocks of matter or concepts. It is typically employed to describe the smallest unit or essential part that forms a larger whole.

examples.german: Das Periodensystem enthält alle chemischen Elemente.
examples.english: The periodic table contains all chemical elements.

examples.german: Wasser besteht aus den Elementen Wasserstoff und Sauerstoff.
examples.english: Water consists of the elements hydrogen and oxygen.

examples.german: Die Erde besteht hauptsächlich aus den Elementen Sauerstoff, Silizium, Aluminium und Eisen.
examples.english: The Earth consists mainly of the elements oxygen, silicon, aluminum, and iron.

examples.german: Das chemische Element Gold hat das Symbol Au und die Ordnungszahl 79.
examples.english: The chemical element gold has the symbol Au and the atomic number 79.

examples.german: Die Elemente in der Natur sind in verschiedenen Verbindungen vorhanden.
examples.english: The elements in nature are present in various compounds.
